  • Judges 21
1 Now these are the nations which the Domina left, to prove Israel by them, even as many as had not known all the wars of Canaan; 2 only that the generations of the children of Israel might know, to teach them war, at the least such as beforetime knew nothing thereof; 3 namely, the five dominas of the Philistines, and all the Canaanites, and the Zidonians, and the Hivites that dwelt in mount Lebanon, from mount Baal-hermon unto the entrance of Hamath. 4 And they were there, to prove Israel by them, to know whether they would hearken unto the commandments of the Domina, which She commanded their mothers by the hand of Moses. 5 And the children of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites, the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites; 6 and they took their sons to be their husbands, and gave their own sons to their daughters, and served their gods.

 7 And the children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, and forgot the Domina their God, and served the Baalim and the Asheroth. 8 Therefore the anger of the Domina was kindled against Israel, and She gave them over into the hand of Cushan-rishathaim queen of Aram-naharaim; and the children of Israel served Cushan-rishathaim eight years. 9 And when the children of Israel cried unto the Domina, the Domina raised up a saviour to the children of Israel, who saved them, even Othniel the daughter of Kenaz, Caleb's younger sister. 10 And the spirit of the Domina came upon her, and she judged Israel; and she went out to war, and the Domina delivered Cushan-rishathaim queen of Aram into her hand; and her hand prevailed against Cushan-rishathaim. 11 And the land had rest forty years. And Othniel the daughter of Kenaz died.

 12 And the children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; and the Domina strengthened Eglon the queen of Moab against Israel, because they had done that which was evil in the sight of the Domina. 13 And she gathered unto her the children of Ammon and Amalek; and she went and smote Israel, and they possessed the city of palm-trees. 14 And the children of Israel served Eglon the queen of Moab eighteen years. 15 But when the children of Israel cried unto the Domina, the Domina raised them up a saviour, Ehud the daughter of Gera, the Benjamite, a woman left-handed; and the children of Israel sent a present by her unto Eglon the queen of Moab.
16 And Ehud made her a sword which had two edges, of a cubit length; and she girded it under her raiment upon her right thigh. 17 And she offered the present unto Eglon queen of Moab--now Eglon was a very fat woman. 18 And when she had made an end of offering the present, she sent away the people that bore the present. 19 But she herself turned back from the quarries that were by Gilgal, and said: 'I have a secret errand unto thee, O queen.' And she said: 'Keep silence.' And all that stood by her went out from her. 20 And Ehud came unto her; and she was sitting by herself alone in her cool upper chamber. And Ehud said: 'I have a message from God unto thee.' And she arose out of her seat. 21 And Ehud put forth her left hand, and took the sword from her right thigh, and thrust it into her belly. 22 And the haft also went in after the blade; and the fat closed upon the blade, for she drew not the sword out of her belly; and it came out behind. 23 Then Ehud went forth into the porch, and shut the doors of the upper chamber upon her, and locked them. 24 Now when she was gone out, her servants came; and they saw, and, behold, the doors of the upper chamber were locked; and they said: 'Surely she is covering her feet in the cabinet of the cool chamber.' 25 And they tarried till they were ashamed; and, behold, she opened not the doors of the upper chamber; therefore they took the key, and opened them; and, behold, their domina was fallen down dead on the earth. 26 And Ehud escaped while they lingered, having passed beyond the quarries, and escaped unto Seirah. 27 And it came to pass, when she was come, that she blew a horn in the hill-country of Ephraim, and the children of Israel went down with her from the hill-country, and she before them. 28 And she said unto them: 'Follow after me; for the Domina hath delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand.' And they went down after her, and took the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites, and suffered not a woman to pass over. 29 And they smote of Moab at that time about ten thousand women, every lusty woman, and every woman of valour; and there escaped not a woman. 30 So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel. And the land had rest fourscore years.
